content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This coding problem is interesting because of its context (basketball) and because it mixes mathematics and logic to determine who wins the basketball game.
This problem provides practice in working with input data, performing mathematical calculations and making decisions based on conditions. It is a fun exercise that can be implemented on Codingame as it is quick to solve and helps to improve understanding and flexibility when coding by considering different scenarios.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This CoC is easy to solve and I can solve this under 5 minutes. 

Nice work!

My solution in Python: 
x,y=0,0
for i in range(int(input())):
    a,b,c=input().split()
    if a=="A":x+=2
    else:y+=2
    if (float(b)**2+float(c)**2)**0.5 > 6.75:
        if a=="B":y+=1 
        else: x+=1
print("ALICE"if x>y else"BOB"if y>x else"DRAW")

Goal section
* Please change "it goes" to "it is scored from".

* Suggest to change "meters" to "units", because coordinates don't suggest any measurement units on their own.

Input section
* Please change "Ligne 1" to "Line 1".

* Suggest to change "points" to "coordinates".

* Suggest to change "compare" to "consider".

* Please change "N prochaines lignes" to "Next [[N]] lines".

* Please format "A" and "B" as {{constants}}.

* Please change "integers" to "floats".

* Please change "he" to "he/she".

* Please add "separated by a space" after "a basket".

Output section
* Please format "DRAW" as a {{constant}}.

Stub generator
* Please provide one string and two floats in line 2.

* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write winner").

Cases
* I didn't check, but are there any cases where a distance of exactly 6.75 units is tested?

Thanks.

Hello 5DN1L, 
Thank you very much for all your advises !
I corrected all your modifications.
For the cases, I already wrote the cases with exactly 6.75 units in "Float number":
B 5 -4.55  = (6.76)
A 0 6.75   =  (6.75)

Have good evening :)

Thanks! Hope you have a good evening too.

Here are my comments on the revised version:

Goal section
* There might be some confusion on the change I commented. No worries, based on the current version, please change the second sentence to:

Each ball scored earns 2 points, but if it is scored from <<strictly more>> than <<6.75 units>> away, it earns 3 points.

Input section
* Please change [[p]] to [[player]] for consistency with the stub generator.

Thank you again. :)

Perfect !
Thank you very much for your help, it's my first contribution so I'm happy to have someone like you who give me theses advises.
Have a great day !
